name: MedGlobal
mission: MedGlobal works closely with our partners to provide a range of health services at our health post in the Kutupalong refugee camp.
programs: Lebanon- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
Palestinian Territories - Development and Relief Services
Sudan- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
theoryOfChange: By partnering with local leaders and health professionals to deliver urgent care while investing in sustainable, community-owned solutions, MedGlobal builds stronger healthcare systems that endure beyond immediate crises.
zakatClaimEvidence: MedGlobal is a Zakat-eligible charity organization that saves lives and provides medical relief and services to refugees and victims of disasters in 14 different countries. Additionally, their website features a section titled "Calculate Your Zakat. Easily calculate your zakat and give where it will save lives and restore dignity.". Furthermore, MedGlobal explicitly states, "Your zakat and sadaqah can bring healing to those who need it most." and "Your donation and Zakat this Ramadan, no matter the size, can save lives and offer hope to those caught in this humanitarian crisis.". (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGsrddAnC2n9zxsoDO3wYGpr8KxyIs6-mL0zy8vwhXLW8gAPMgaps9vIvDKMa8vBtv2DipQ920elbCf6gPKDLI7mKt0_1ejwjfdkqEvMIWmLGWeA-XPzGPUnRyJSjw-Zvm-RQqO8cyKX21Yanpazp3VhW1K4rEO3lsS0OBTan6PDdCRRe6LeMSI)

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 39/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: The rationale does not explicitly mention the small board size (1 member) as the key risk factor, which led to a risk deduction of -5 points. While the 'score_summary' mentions 'minor risk deductions applied', it doesn't specify the reason.
Evaluation source domain 'charitywatch.org' is not a known trusted evaluator

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 1 members

score_details.score_summary: MedGlobal, Inc. earns 78/100 due to exceptional impact and strong alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

Additionally, their website features a section titled "Calculate Your Zakat. Easily calculate your zakat and give where it will save lives and restore dignity.". Furthermore, MedGlobal explicitly states, "Your zakat and sadaqah can bring healing to those who need it most." and "Your donation and Zakat this Ramadan, no matter the size, can save lives and offer hope to those caught in this humanitarian crisis.". all_citations.claim: The charity offers various donation options and is identified as zakat-eligible.
MedGlobal has a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100 and maintains a fundraising efficiency of $0.13 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $12,632,992, a program expense ratio of 85.9%, and working capital of 3.4 months.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MedGlobal earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and direct impact model, which allows for a very low cost per beneficiary. Its status as zakat-eligible further enhances its appeal to donors seeking high-urgency humanitarian alignment.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are limited to 3.4 months of operations
High reliance on specific emergency response zones which may fluctuate in accessibility

dimension_explanations.alignment: MedGlobal is highly aligned with humanitarian causes and is zakat-eligible, offering various giving methods for donors to support emergency response and long-term relief [1][2]. The organization addresses urgent needs in high-priority areas like Syria and Bangladesh, fitting the profile for donors focused on global health crises [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of medical services, maintaining an 85.9% program expense ratio to ensure funds reach the field [2][3]. With a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100, the charity shows strong evidence of financial health and operational effectiveness [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: MedGlobal, Inc. provides critical healthcare services and emergency relief to vulnerable populations in conflict zones and disaster-stricken regions.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 85.9%
Strong accountability and transparency with a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100
Low fundraising costs, spending only $0.13 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: MedGlobal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization that delivers a wide range of health services through partnerships, including a dedicated health post in the Kutupalong refugee camp [2][3]. The organization manages a total revenue of $12,632,992 to support development and relief services in Bangladesh, Syria, and Pakistan [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MedGlobal earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and direct impact model, which allows for a very low cost per beneficiary. Its status as zakat-eligible further enhances its appeal to donors seeking high-urgency humanitarian alignment.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current board size is noted as a risk factor with <cite id="2">only 1 member</cite> identified in some governance assessments, which may limit oversight diversity.
While internal metrics are tracked, the organization could benefit from <cite id="2">independent third-party evaluations</cite> to validate long-term health outcomes.

bbb_assessment.summary: Recognized as an Accredited Charity by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high transparency in other areas, including a Platinum Candid profile.
risk_factors: <cite id="2">Board governance is considered weak</cite> due to limited membership.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is organizational governance, specifically a <cite id="2">critically small board size</cite> which poses a risk to long-term institutional oversight.

confidence.data_freshness: Data from 2022 tax year and 2024 ratings
confidence.notes: Strong financial and transparency data available.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="1">zakat-eligible</cite> and serves <cite id="2">vulnerable populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite> like Gaza and Yemen.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust MedGlobal due to its <cite id="2">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and its <cite id="2">98.98.33333333333333/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="2">expand its board of directors</cite> to include more independent members.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient, spending <cite id="2">100.0% on programs</cite> with an exceptional <cite id="2">$0.48 cost per beneficiary</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="2">tracking outcomes for 3+ years</cite> and publishing external evaluation documents.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal outcome tracking with 5 metrics

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provision through medical missions rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: MedGlobal, Inc. provides critical healthcare services and emergency relief to vulnerable populations in conflict zones and disaster-stricken regions.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize immediate, life-saving medical interventions in high-conflict zones and want their zakat to reach beneficiaries with zero overhead leakage.
donor_motivations: Want to support medical relief in Gaza, Syria, and Yemen
Value extreme financial efficiency and 85.9% program ratios
Prefer organizations with high third-party transparency ratings
Seek to fulfill zakat through healthcare for the displaced
giving_considerations: Donations support direct provision of medical supplies and staff
The organization is relatively young, founded in 2017
Focus is on acute crisis response and health system strengthening
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those who prioritize organizations with large, established multi-member boards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that the organization <cite id="2">tracks 5 outcome metrics</cite> and has one external evaluation, but lacks long-term longitudinal studies.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MedGlobal provides immediate health services to address acute needs while training local staff to ensure the sustainability of health systems in crisis zones.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions are effectively reducing mortality and morbidity in refugee settings.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The ongoing crises in Gaza, Sudan, and Ukraine present a high demand for MedGlobal's specialized medical services.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Gaza, Sudan, Ukraine, Syria, Yemen, Bangladesh, Pakistan

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="2">100.0% program ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="2">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar healthcare focus and organizational size
similar_organizations.name: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar direct medical provision in conflict zones
similar_organizations.name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="2">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> and a low fundraising efficiency of <cite id="2">$0.13 per $1 raised</cite>.
MedGlobal holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid and a <cite id="2">98.33/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>.
The charity achieves a remarkably low <cite id="2">cost of $0.48 per beneficiary</cite> through its direct service delivery model.

strengths_deep_dive: MedGlobal's operational model is built on extreme efficiency and direct intervention. By utilizing a network of medical volunteers and local partners, they maintain <cite id="2">3.4 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability for emergency responses. Their accountability is further evidenced by <cite id="2">perfect scores of 100 in both Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons from Charity Navigator, alongside a <cite id="2">98/100 score for Accountability</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: MedGlobal, Inc. is a high-impact humanitarian organization founded in <cite id="2">2017</cite> that provides critical healthcare services to vulnerable populations in conflict zones and disaster-stricken regions. The organization reported <cite id="3">$12,632,992 in total revenue</cite> for the 2022 tax year, demonstrating a robust capacity to mobilize resources for global health crises. MedGlobal distinguishes itself through a direct provision model, operating health posts in locations like the <cite id="2">Kutupalong refugee camp</cite> and providing services across <cite id="2">Gaza, Sudan, Ukraine, and Syria</cite>. Their financial management is exceptionally lean, maintaining a <cite id="2">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> according to recent filings, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized almost entirely for medical missions and health system strengthening. The organization has earned a <cite id="2">98.33/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a deep commitment to transparency and ethical governance. Beyond emergency relief, MedGlobal invests in <cite id="2">medical training and surgical skills labs</cite> to build long-term local healthcare capacity in underserved regions such as <cite id="2">Yemen, Bangladesh, and Pakistan</cite>.
